title: R43317
content: This report provides links to cybersecurity-related bills with committee, floor, or chamber action. It lists House and Senate bills in the 116th and 115th Congress. In the 116th Congress, the House passed four bills and the Senate considered four, passing one. Thirty-one bills received consideration in the 115th Congress, with five becoming public laws. The National Defense Authorization Acts for Fiscal Years 2018 and 2019 established cybersecurity efforts, new rules, and programs related to information security, including a ban on Kaspersky Lab software and the definition of "cyberwar." The bills also address Department of Defense military activities and cybersecurity matters. The FITARA Enhancement Act of 2017 (P.L. 115-88) requires risk management reviews for high-risk IT investments. The Strengthening State and Local Cyber Crime Fighting Act of 2017 (P.L. 115-76) authorizes a National Computer Forensics Institute within the U.S. Secret Service. The National Computer Forensics Institute is authorized by the Strengthening State and Local Cyber Crime Fighting Act of 2017 (P.L. 115-76) to disseminate information on cyber and electronic crime prevention. Various reports by Eric A. Fischer provide insights on cybersecurity legislation and information sharing. Tables 5 to 8 list cybersecurity hearings in the 116th Congress, with House and Senate hearings arranged by date and committee. The selection of hearings is not definitive, and titles are active links to the committee's website. The curr_chunk provides a list of House and Senate hearings on cybersecurity issues, with tables arranged by date and committee. The selection of hearings is not definitive, and titles are active links to the committee's website for further information.
